contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{Taxobox | name = Lophognathus | image =Lophognathus_temporalis_(TaTa_Lizard).jpg | image_caption = Striped Water dragon also known as the Northern Water dragon, ''Lophognathus temporalis'' | image_width = | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Reptile|Reptilia]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] | familia = [[Agamidae]] | subfamilia = [[Agaminae]] | genus = '''''Lophognathus''''' | genus_authority = [[John Edward Gray|Gray]], 1842 }} '''''Lophognathus''''' is a genus of lizards found in northern [[Australia]], [[New Guinea]], and [[Tanimbar Islands]]. The five species are informally described as [[dragon]]s, as are several genera in the family [[Agamidae]], and closely related to those of ''[[Amphibolurus]]''. ''Lophognathus'' species are slender, slightly compressed, agamid lizards that are often found in trees. They occur in a variety of habitat, including sand dunes and arid regions, but frequently near watercourses. Two species are endemic to Australia, ''Lophognathus gilberti'' and ''L. longirostris'', ''L. temporalis'' is also found in New Guinea.<ref>{{cite book|last=Cogger|first=Harold G.|title=Reptiles and Amphibians of Australia}}</ref> In Australia, these lizards are colloquially known as "Ta Ta" Lizards, due to their habit of "waving" after running across hot surfaces. The type locality of ''Lophognathus maculilabris'' was given as the Timor Laut Islands.<ref name="J. Craig Venter Institute ">{{cite web|url=http://reptile-database.reptarium.cz/species.php?genus=Lophognathus&species=maculilabris|title=Lophognathus maculilabris BOULENGER, 1883|work=Reptiles Database|publisher=\J. Craig Venter Institute |accessdate=2009-01-02}}</ref> The first description was by [[John Edward Gray]] in 1842.<ref>Gray, J. E. 1842. Description of some hitherto unrecorded species of Australian reptiles and batrachians. Zoological Miscellany, London: Treuttel, Würtz & Co, pp. 51—57.</ref> The species he described was named after [[John Gilbert (naturalist)]], the collector of the [[type specimen]]s. ==Species== [[File:Lophognathus maculilabris Smit.jpg|thumb|Illustration of ''L. maculilabris'' by [[Joseph Smit]]]] Five species are currently recognized in this genus:<ref>[http://jcvi.org/reptiles/search.php?taxon=&genus=Lophognathus&submit=Search ''Lophognathus''], The Reptiles Database</ref> *''[[Lophognathus burnsi]]'' Wells & Wellington, 1985 *''[[Lophognathus gilberti]]'' (Gray, 1842) – Gilbert's Lashtail, Gilbert's Dragon *''[[Lophognathus longirostris]]'' (Boulenger, 1883) – Long-snouted Lashtail, Long-nosed Water Dragon *''[[Lophognathus maculilabris]]'' (Boulenger, 1883) *''[[Lophognathus temporalis]]'' (Günther, 1867) – Striped Water dragon, Swamplands Lashtail, Northern Water Dragon ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Agamidae]] [[Category:Reptiles of Australia]] [[Category:Reptiles of New Guinea]] {{agamidae-stub}}
